description: From Latin eviternus, aeternus, aeviternitas (“eviternity”) + -al. See eternal.

examples: What is the heaven itself, but (as Gerson compares it well) as a great clock regularly moving in an equall sway of all the orbs, without difference of poyse, without variation of minutes, in a constant state of eviternall evennesse, both of being and motion.
